docs.snippet: Evidence of the Rohingya Muslims’ history in Myanmar is being systematically eradicated. One prominent Rohingya asks, “How can they pretend we are nothing?”

headline.print_headline: Myanmar Threatens to Wipe Rohingya From Memory
headline.main: ‘No Such Thing as Rohingya’: Myanmar Erases a History

docs.snippet: We all lose because of the biases of Wall Street and Silicon Valley.
Avi Gabbay surprised the country in July when he took control of Labor. Now, shellshocked liberals must decide whether to follow his lead.

headline.print_headline: Leading Israel’s Left While Appealing to Its Right
headline.main: Pumping New Life into Israel’s Labor Party, From the Right

docs.snippet: Thursday: A look back at some of the city’s happier moments, celebrating the winter solstice, and our readers share their best news of 2017.

headline.main: New York Today: The Year in (Good) News

docs.snippet: Tonight, make Gabrielle Hamilton’s recipe for le grand aioli, a garlicky mayonnaise served with cod and vegetables, and plan for the days ahead.
The White House played down George Papadopoulos’s role in the Trump campaign and described him as “a volunteer member of an advisory council that literally met one time.”

headline.print_headline: Aide Lauded By President Forged Ties To Russians
headline.main: George Papadopoulos, First to Plead Guilty in Russia Inquiry

docs.snippet: Chris Wilson, a former professional football player, returned to his Michigan hometown to coach its last remaining public high school team, offering lessons that go far beyond the field.

headline.main: In Flint, High School Football Is No Game

docs.abstract: Chris Wilson, a former professional football player, returned to his Michigan hometown to coach its last remaining public high school team, offering lessons that go far beyond the field.

docs.snippet: Three professors from the Department of Psychological and Brain Sciences have been put on paid leave as a criminal investigation is carried out.

headline.print_headline: 3 Dartmouth College Professors Are Targeted in Sexual Misconduct Inquiry
headline.main: Dartmouth College Professors Investigated Over Sexual Misconduct Allegations

docs.snippet: The Irish capital’s economy is booming, but the city is not known for contemporary art and has a long way to go to rival more established international hubs.

headline.print_headline: Dublin Has a ‘Grass-Roots’ Gallery Weekend. How Much Can It Grow?
headline.main: Dublin Has a ‘Grass-Roots’ Gallery Weekend. How Much Can It Grow?

docs.snippet: For the first time, The New York Times will send a journalist to visit each destination on our yearly “52 Places to Go” list. Here’s what the job is — and isn’t.

headline.main: Why Send a Journalist on a 52-Week Trot Around the Globe?
